{"step_by_step_thinking": "The antidote for heparin is protamine sulphate. Protamine sulphate is a positively charged molecule that binds to heparin, neutralizing its anticoagulant effects. Penicillinase is an enzyme used to break down penicillin, not heparin. Pryosulphate and potassium sulphate are not antidotes for heparin.", "answer_choice": "B"}
